title: Developing Instructional Design Judgment Skills Through Case-Based Reflective Practice in Large-Scale Education

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational instructional design theories and experience in developing science education content
context.additional_context: Strengthening instructional design capabilities specialized for science education, offering VR simulation-based mock classroom environments and opportunities for multidimensional design decision-making practice

learning_goals: Learners can comparatively analyze three or more alternative approaches to science instructional design under various constraints.
Learners can explain rationales for their design decisions with over 80% accuracy by applying a reflective practice process.
Learners can improve design judgment skills by performing five or more iterative design-execution-evaluation cycles in simulation/VR environments.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
